lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
You can add 3 types of tasks, todo, deadline and event, into your task list.
This feature is to allow you to mark the task as done.
If you have finished the task, you can mark the task as done.
This feature is to let to mark the task as undone.
If you have not finished the task, you can mark the task as undone.
This feature is to list all the tasks in the task list.
This feature is to delete the specific task according to its index number.
Once you have entered the command, the task will be removed from the list.
Find all the tasks according to the keywords in the command.
Add to do to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Add deadline to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Add event to the task list
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][ ] read books from: Feb 2nd to: Feb 28th
Nice! I've marked this task as done:)
Nice! I've unmarked this task as done:P
Delete the task and show the total number of tasks
Got it. I've removed this task:
There are 4 tasks in your list.
Find the tasks according to keywords
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
3. [E][ ] read books from: Feb 2nd to: Feb 28th
5. [E][ ] read books from: Feb 2nd to: Feb 28th
* This part of the code is taken from the module website
* The code is to show welcome message and continuously loop to read in user input, until user input is "exit"
* Read in user command and use Parser to parse the command and create a command object
* Execute the command based on the user command
* Write the task list to file before exit the programme.
* Create a Duke object and create / find the data file and start the Duke
* Represent an Add command and add the task in the list
* Add the task according to the command line
* Check the starting word of the command and parser the command accordingly to obtain the details
* If the command starts with to do, add to do task
* If the command starts with deadline, add deadline task
* If the command starts with event, add event task
* If the command does not match either of the key word, it will throw CommandFormat Exception
* @throws CommandFormatException if the command line is incorrect
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) throws CommandFormatException {

* @throws TaskException            if the task list is empty
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) throws CommandFormatException,

public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {

* Mark the task as done according to the index number

* @throws TaskException            if there is no task in the list

public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) throws TaskOutOfBoundsException,
* Change the task to undone according to the index number
* Check the command format and unmark the task according to the task number
* @throws TaskOutOfBoundsException if the task number is out of bound
* @throws TaskUndoneException      if the user wants to unmark the undone task
* @throws TaskException            if the task list is empty
* @throws CommandFormatException   if the command is in incorrect format
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) throws TaskOutOfBoundsException,
* CommandFormatException is used when the command line is in wrong format
"No...please key in proper command...type 'help' to show command list...";
* DukeException Class to show the error messages
* TaskDoneException is used when the task has been done
public final String TASK_DONE = "This task has been done!";
* TaskException is used when the task list is empty
public final String EMPTY_LIST = "Sorry...Your task list is empty...";
* TaskFormatException is used when the task format is wrong
"No...please key in proper command...type 'help' to show command list...";
* TaskMatchException is used when there is no task matching the keywords in the command
"Sorry, I am unable to find the task.";
* TaskOutOfBoundsException is used when the user input the invalid task number
public final String OUT_OF_BOUNDS = "Please enter the correct task number!";
* when if the user wants to unmark the undone task
public final String TASK_UNDONE = "You have not finished this task yet.";

private static final String OPENING_LINE = "Hello! I'm Duke!"
+ "Type 'help' to see what you can do!";
"Bye. Hope to see you again soon! I will be missing you:(";

private final String FIND_LINE = "Here are the matching tasks in your list: \n";
private static final String HELP = "    todo {description} --add todo" + "\n"
+ "    mark {task index number} --mark the task as done" + "\n"
+ "    unmark {task index number} --mark the task as undone" + "\n"
+ "    list --to show the current task list";
